verses.text: The Lord spoke to Moses and Aaron, saying to them,
verses.comment: Opening address introducing the laws of clean and unclean animals.

verses.text: Speak to the people of Israel, saying: These are the animals that you may eat among all the animals that are on the earth.
verses.comment: God sets out dietary laws for Israel.

verses.text: Whatever parts the hoof and is cloven-footed and chews the cud, among the animals, you may eat.
verses.comment: Criteria for clean land animals: split hooves and chewing cud.

verses.text: Nevertheless, among those that chew the cud or part the hoof, you shall not eat these: the camel, because it chews the cud but does not part the hoof, it is unclean to you;
verses.comment: Specific example of an unclean animal.

verses.text: and the rock badger, because it chews the cud but does not part the hoof, it is unclean to you;
verses.comment: "Rock badger" translates Hebrew "shaphan," possibly coney or hyrax.

verses.text: and the hare, because it chews the cud but does not part the hoof, it is unclean to you;
verses.comment: "Chews the cud" here describes behavior that appeared similar to Israelites.

verses.text: and the pig, because it parts the hoof and is cloven-footed but does not chew the cud, it is unclean to you.
verses.comment: Another example of an unclean animal, despite split hooves.

verses.text: You shall not eat their flesh, and you shall not touch their carcasses; they are unclean to you.
verses.comment: Both eating and physical contact with the carcass are prohibited.

verses.text: These you may eat of all that are in the waters: whatever has fins and scales in the waters, in the seas and in the rivers, you may eat.
verses.comment: Clean aquatic creatures must have both fins and scales.

verses.text: But anything in the seas or the rivers that does not have fins and scales, of all that swarms in the waters and of all the living creatures that are in the waters, is detestable to you.
verses.comment: Eels, shellfish, etc., are considered "detestable," not to be eaten.

verses.text: They shall be detestable to you; you shall not eat their flesh, and you shall regard their carcasses as detestable.
verses.comment: Repetition for emphasis: not to eat or touch.

verses.text: Whatever has no fins and scales in the waters is detestable to you.
verses.comment: Summary statement regarding aquatic creatures.

verses.text: These you shall regard as detestable among the birds: they shall not be eaten; they are detestable: the eagle, the vulture, the black vulture,
verses.comment: List of unclean birds begins.

verses.text: the kite, the falcon of every kind,
verses.comment: Types of raptors and birds of prey are listed.

verses.text: every raven of every kind,
verses.comment: Raven and similar birds; generally scavengers.

verses.text: the ostrich, the short-eared owl, the gull, and the hawk of every kind,
verses.comment: Some bird names are uncertain; translated as best guessed species.

verses.text: the little owl, the cormorant, the great owl,
verses.comment: Names according to common identification.

verses.text: the barn owl, the desert owl, the buzzard,
verses.comment: Some Hebrew bird species are uncertain.

verses.text: the stork, the heron of every kind, the hoopoe, and the bat.
verses.comment: The bat is included among flying things despite being a mammal.

verses.text: All winged insects that go on all fours are detestable to you.
verses.comment: Four-legged flying things refers to insects as perceived by ancients.

verses.text: Yet among all the winged insects that go on all fours, you may eat those that have jointed legs above their feet, to leap on the earth.
verses.comment: Certain jumping insects are allowed (see next verse).

verses.text: Of them you may eat: the locust of any kind, the bald locust of any kind, the cricket of any kind, and the grasshopper of any kind.
verses.comment: Locust, grasshopper, and their close relatives are clean.

verses.text: But all other winged insects that have four feet are detestable to you.
verses.comment: Non-jumping insects are prohibited as food.

verses.text: By these you shall become unclean. Whoever touches their carcass shall be unclean until the evening,
verses.comment: Touching the carcasses causes ritual uncleanness temporarily.

verses.text: and whoever carries any part of their carcass shall wash his clothes and be unclean until the evening.
verses.comment: Additional requirement: wash garments for those carrying a carcass.

verses.text: Every animal that parts the hoof but is not cloven-footed or does not chew the cud is unclean to you; whoever touches them shall be unclean.
verses.comment: Restates rule for land animal uncleanness.

verses.text: All that walk on their paws, among the animals that go on all fours, are unclean to you; whoever touches their carcass shall be unclean until the evening,
verses.comment: Likely refers to dogs, cats, and other carnivores.

verses.text: and whoever carries their carcass shall wash his clothes and be unclean until the evening; they are unclean to you.
verses.comment: Repeats cleansing procedure for handling unclean carcasses.

verses.text: These are unclean to you among the creatures that swarm on the ground: the mole, the rat, the lizard of each kind,
verses.comment: "Swarming" covers small ground creatures; some names uncertain.

verses.text: the gecko, the monitor lizard, the wall lizard, the skink, and the chameleon.
verses.comment: Ancient names matched to modern lizard species as closely as possible.

verses.text: These are unclean to you among all that swarm. Whoever touches their carcass shall be unclean until the evening.
verses.comment: Repeats the ritual impurity from contact.

verses.text: And anything on which any of them falls when they are dead shall be unclean, whether it is an article of wood or clothing or skin or sack, any article that is used for any purpose; it must be put into water, and it shall be unclean until the evening; then it shall be clean.
verses.comment: Cleansing required for contaminated objects.

verses.text: And if any of them falls into any earthen vessel, all that is in it shall be unclean, and you shall break it.
verses.comment: Earthenware vessels must be destroyed—cannot be purified.

verses.text: Any food that could be eaten, on which water comes, shall be unclean, and any drink that could be drunk, from any such vessel, shall be unclean.
verses.comment: Contaminated food and drink are unclean.

verses.text: And everything on which any part of their carcass falls shall be unclean; whether oven or stove, it shall be broken down; they are unclean, and shall be unclean to you.
verses.comment: Ovens and cooking equipment must be destroyed if contaminated.

verses.text: Nevertheless, a spring or cistern holding water shall be clean, but whoever touches their carcass shall be unclean.
verses.comment: Large water sources are not made unclean by contact with carcass.

verses.text: And if any part of their carcass falls on any seeds that are to be sown, they are clean;
verses.comment: Seeds for sowing not made unclean by mere contact.

verses.text: but if water is put on the seed and any part of their carcass falls on it, it is unclean to you.
verses.comment: If the seed is moistened before contact, impurity transfers.

verses.text: If any animal that you may eat dies, whoever touches its carcass shall be unclean until the evening,
verses.comment: Even clean animal carcasses confer ritual uncleanness when dead.

verses.text: and whoever eats of its carcass shall wash his clothes and be unclean until the evening, and whoever carries its carcass shall wash his clothes and be unclean until the evening.
verses.comment: Eating or handling dead clean animals still requires cleansing.

verses.text: Every creature that swarms on the ground is detestable and shall not be eaten.
verses.comment: "Swarming" covers crawling or creeping small creatures.

verses.text: Whatever goes on its belly, and whatever goes on all fours, or whatever has many feet among all swarming creatures that swarm on the ground, you shall not eat, for they are detestable.
verses.comment: Includes snakes, worms, centipedes, and similar.

verses.text: Do not make yourselves detestable by any swarming thing, nor make yourselves unclean with them, so that you become defiled by them.
verses.comment: Call to avoid defilement and ritual impurity.

verses.text: For I am the Lord your God. Consecrate yourselves therefore, and be holy, for I am holy. Do not defile yourselves with any swarming thing that moves on the ground.
verses.comment: Grounds dietary laws in the holiness of God.

verses.text: For I am the Lord who brought you up out of the land of Egypt to be your God. You shall therefore be holy, for I am holy.
verses.comment: Holiness required because of God's acts and character.

verses.text: This is the law about animal and bird and every living creature that moves in the waters and every creature that swarms on the earth,
verses.comment: Summary statement regarding the rules detailed above.

verses.text: to make a distinction between the unclean and the clean, and between the living creature that may be eaten and the living creature that may not be eaten.
verses.comment: Marks the purpose: separating clean from unclean according to God's command.
